story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful land of Ethiopia, there lived a young boy named Tewodros. Tewodros was a kind and brave boy who loved to explore the lush green forests and majestic mountains of his land. He was known among his friends for his adventurous spirit and his caring heart.

One day, as Tewodros was playing by a sparkling river, he heard a faint whimpering sound coming from the bushes nearby. Curious, he followed the sound and discovered a tiny baby lion cub trapped in a thicket. The poor cub looked scared and hungry, so Tewodros gently freed him and carried him back to his village.

Tewodros knew that he had to help the baby lion and decided to take care of him. He named the cub Simba, which means "lion" in the Ethiopian language. Simba grew up strong and healthy under Tewodros's loving care, and they became the best of friends, embarking on many adventures together.

As the sun set over the horizon, Tewodros would sit with Simba under the wide-open sky and tell him stories of the brave warriors and wise elders of Ethiopia. He would share tales of the ancient mountains and the colorful festivals that filled the land with joy and laughter.

Together, Tewodros and Simba roamed the vast Ethiopian plains, spreading kindness and friendship wherever they went. Their bond was unbreakable, and they taught everyone they met the value of compassion, courage, and unity.

And so, every night, as the stars twinkled above, Tewodros and Simba would curl up together under the warm Ethiopian sky, knowing that their love and friendship would forever light up the land of Ethiopia.

And with that heartwarming story, Tewodros drifted off to sleep, dreaming of the adventures that awaited him and his loyal friend, Simba, in the enchanted land of Ethiopia.
